lines.text: I've got it- it's all about Slick!
I mean, he died in a really weird way, right?
Getting frozen, then getting set on fire... kind of a mess, right?
So, if the <c=#0000FF>Stop Wizard</c> could really cast <c=#0000FF>Flesh to Stone,</c> why'd he bother with <c=#0000FF>Mass Arrest Momentum?</c>
He could've just blasted him right out the gate. Implies he couldn't actually do that, right?
Please. I can think of- of a hundred reasons he wouldn't.
He didn't want to have to dispose of a statue. He didn't want to risk a backfire. He wanted to... harvest his organs.
Harvest his organs?! Dude, that's nuts!
Yeah- everyone knows if you're gonna use organs in a spell, the best ones come from the pure of heart.
What would they want with shoddy third-rate criminal organs?
I'm... gonna pretend I didn't hear that.
And... the thing I didn't hear aside, she's got a point. Slick not bein' a statue ain't concrete proof.
